name: sfchronicle
text:
Here's a list of the Bay Area curfews, plus major service and business closures. The list will continue to be updated.

https://t.co/UXnpqKefoj

name: sfchronicle
text: A curfew for downtown Lafayette will take effect at 9 p.m. Monday night and last until 5 a.m. https://t.co/A4olC4Ce6w

name: sfchronicle
text: Warriors reopened their practice facility to players for individual workouts on Monday.  https://t.co/DzgVu9A1hv https://t.co/KDwpNnW1Lq

name: sfchronicle
text: Police have cleared protesters off U.S. 101 in Santa Rosa roughly 45 minutes after demonstrators gathered there. https://t.co/tHKlACTfLI

name: sfchronicle
text: California’s contract with BYD states that the deal is void and the company must forfeit all $495 million that the state prepaid for the N95 masks if it failed to obtain federal certification by the deadline. https://t.co/quoHdQIcEW

name: sfchronicle
text:
“It’s pretty devastating and heartbreaking. Reopening really depends on a case-by-case basis now. Some businesses were completely destroyed and they’ll take longer to recover.”

https://t.co/1ehwvcgiTG

name: sfchronicle
text: Traffic has resumed on Interstate 680 in Walnut Creek after police officers used tear gas, rubber bullets and flash bangs to clear protesters who blocked lanes in both directions. https://t.co/V875EN44dq

name: sfchronicle
text: Lafayette’s curfew, which applies to its downtown area, is now 8 p.m., not 9 p.m., according to the city. https://t.co/Cd9K5rwxAt

name: sfchronicle
text:
A truck — displaying the names of Bay Area people killed by police — drives alongside demonstrators in Oakland protesting police brutality and the police killing of George Floyd.

Live updates: https://t.co/yo4wAY4SI0 https://t.co/457friZBE4

name: sfchronicle
text:
Demonstrators engage officers in Oakland while protesting police brutality and the police killing of George Floyd.

This young woman asks police why there’s a curfew, when 1,000 people peacefully protested today, reports @MalloryMoench.

Live updates: https://t.co/yo4wAY4SI0 https://t.co/p0vkVwX11V

name: sfchronicle
text:
There just had to be a Game 7 at Oracle Park.

Southern California made another shocking late-inning comeback to beat Northern California 7-3 in Game 6 of the I-5 Series. https://t.co/OjsQqDsld5 https://t.co/U208rz8UiW

name: sfchronicle
text: An online petition circulating among infectious disease and public health professionals is calling on law enforcement to stop using tear gas. https://t.co/nfLlQJb4xb

name: sfchronicle
text: According to a UCSF spokesperson, the petition says tear gas "could make the respiratory tract more susceptible to… https://t.co/96S47qLivQ

name: sfchronicle
text: The SF public defender is calling for an overhaul on use-of-force policies at the SFPD, after a bystander video surfaced last week that appeared to show an officer pressing her knee on a black teenager’s neck. https://t.co/wI8kChd1wm

name: sfchronicle
text:
There just had to be a Game 7 at Oracle Park.

Here's how to follow the finale of "Golden Greats: The I-5 Series":
https://t.co/vdgrKnqW1T https://t.co/rMVi6T1P2S

name: sfchronicle
text: Multiple people have been arrested in connection with vandalized windows and property in downtown Walnut Creek, according to the Walnut Creek police department. https://t.co/6gWOufWZLC

name: sfchronicle
text: The petition also calls on officials to wear masks, maintain social distancing, and set up hand-washing stations to… https://t.co/vsWx0YnmYe

name: sfchronicle
text:
Protesters travel east on Grand Avenue from Telegraph toward Broadway to meet up with hundreds more demonstrators making their way north, reports @KellieHwang.

Live updates: https://t.co/yo4wAY4SI0 https://t.co/JJdXmIARsO
